definition: Richard Nixon (1913-1994), US president 1969-1974/surname Nixon

variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain

variant of 剋|克[ke4]
to scold/to beat

sentences.english: I conveyed Nixon's crucial decision to Dinitz.
sentences.chinese: 我向迪尼茨转达了尼克松关键性的决定。

sentences.english: Following Nixon's visit to China, the Chinese team came to the United States.
sentences.chinese: 尼克松访华后，中国乒乓球队回访了美国。

sentences.english: Fuck Nixon, I'm sure we can do better.
sentences.chinese: 操尼克松，我相信我们能做得更好。

sentences.english: It has been used repeatedly in history, not least by former U.S. President Richard Nixon.
sentences.chinese: 历史上不乏先例，美国前总统尼克松就是其中之一。

sentences.english: The President Richard Nixon's crumpling up has illustrated the power of the media lively.
sentences.chinese: 尼克松总统的垮台，形象地说明了新闻报道的威力。

sentences.english: In Nixon's tenure, the United States held three Soviet summit.
sentences.chinese: 在尼克松任期内，美苏共举行了三次首脑会晤。

sentences.english: She typed an e-mail to Nixon, who came right away.
sentences.chinese: 她给尼克松发了一封电子邮件，他很快就来了。

sentences.english: Nixon built a one-lane bowling alley below the driveway leading to the North Portico.
sentences.chinese: 尼克松在通向北门廊的行车道下方修了一条保龄球道。

sentences.english: The risk does not detract from nixon's courage in running it .
sentences.chinese: 危险无损于尼克松甘冒风险的勇气。

sentences.english: So Nixon gave them each a White House brooch.
sentences.chinese: 然后，尼克松就送了他们每人一个白宫胸针。

sentences.english: Nixon winces when Hatchett's words are repeated to him.
sentences.chinese: 当尼克松多次听到哈契特的话时他退缩了。

sentences.english: Gillian Anderson and Cynthia Nixon guest star.
sentences.chinese: 吉莉安安德森和辛西娅尼克松客串。

sentences.english: The relationship between Nixon and Agnew illustrated these maxims .
sentences.chinese: 尼克松和阿格纽之间的关系就是这些准则的证明。

sentences.english: Nixon suffered from a cold and bad makeup.
sentences.chinese: 而尼克松由于死板而糟糕的化妆而吃了亏。

sentences.english: The relationship between Nixon and Agnew illustrated these maxims.
sentences.chinese: 尼克松和阿格纽之间的关系就是这些准则的证明。
尼克松的工资和价格监管方案未能奏效。

Gorbachev/Mikhail Sergeyevich Gorbachev (1931-), last president of the Soviet Union 1991-1995
Roosevelt (name)/Theodore Roosevelt (1858-1919), US President 1901-1909/Franklin D. Roosevelt (1882-1945), US President 1933-1945
Tanaka Kakuei (1918-1993), Japanese politician, prime minister 1972-1974
Mrs Thatcher/Baroness Thatcher or Margaret Thatcher (1925-2013), British conservative politician, prime minister 1979-1990
Leonid Brezhnev (1906-1982), Soviet statesman, General Secretary of the Communist Party of the USSR 1966-1982
